attributes.action: Rule out the possibility of a No-deal Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
After the chaotic and incoherent nature of these Brexit negotiations leading to a deal which is extremely unlikely to pass through parliament, we are faced with the option of no-deal.

No deal would lead to 8% loss in Nominal GDP (IMF)
No deal would lead to a shortage of food and medicines
No deal would lead to chaos at Dover and stop goods from entering the UK
No deal could re-ignite violence in Northern Ireland
No deal could ruin the lives of EU citizens in the UK and UK citizens in the EU
attributes.background: Brexit according to many prominent leave campaigners was meant to make Britain more prosperous, free and more united as a country. Liam Fox cited Brexit as "the easiest trade deal in history". It has been anything but and the UK faces the threat of a no-deal Brexit.
